== Introduction ==
{| class="wikitable"
|-

Emulators allow you to run software designed for another operating system and/or hardware. An obvious application of this is to run popular games. In addition to popular games console emulators, there are compatibility layers like <nowiki>[[Wine]]</nowiki> that allow Windows software to be used.

=== Windows Games ===
Some Windows games can run on Ubuntu, but they need either an emulator or a compatibility layer.
==== Windows Emulators ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none;"><nowiki>[[File:WINE.png|WINE logo|align="left", width="50px"]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:none;"><nowiki>[[Wine|WINE]]</nowiki> - A completely free compatability layer that works for some games.
|}
* <nowiki>[[Cedega]]</nowiki> - A commercial compatability layer. This costs money, but works for more games than WINE. (No longer available)
* <nowiki>[[DOSBox]]</nowiki> - A x86 emulator with Tandy/Herc/CGA/EGA/VGA/SVGA graphics, sound and DOS, enables playing old DOS games.
* <nowiki>[[Installation-QemuEmulator|QEMU]]</nowiki> - A virtual machine capable of running Windows.
* <nowiki>[[http://www.playonlinux.com/en/|PlayOnLinux]]</nowiki> - A free WINE-based compatibility layer.
* <nowiki>[[http://www.codeweavers.com/products/cxgames/|Crossover Linux Games]]</nowiki> - A commercial WINE-based program allowing users to run Windows software. This version is tweaked to run Windows games better.

==== Windows Game List ====
Windows games that can be run on Ubuntu with an emulator.

* Anno 1503: The New World
* Counter-Strike: Source
* Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
* Half-Life - A first-person shooter
* Half-Life 2
* <nowiki>[[CounterStrike|Half-Life: Counter-Strike]]</nowiki> - Describes installation and play using WINE.
* Port Royale
* <nowiki>[[RedAlert2|Red Alert 2]]</nowiki> - Information detailing installing and playing with WINE.
* Sacred Underworld
* Stronghold Crusader
* Tortuga: Pirates of the New World
* <nowiki>[[http://jplui.com/geekmadness/2008/06/24/playing-warcraft-iii-and-dota-in-linux/|Warcraft III]]</nowiki> - A guide to using  Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos, Warcraft III: The Frozen Zone and Defense of the Ancients, a custom scenario for Warcraft III with WINE.
* <nowiki>[[WorldofWarcraft|World of Warcraft]]</nowiki> - Describes howto install and play WoW with WINE.

=== Other Emulators ===
* <nowiki>[[http://www.scummvm.org/|ScummVM]]</nowiki> - free implementation of !LucasArts' <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SCUMM|S.C.U.M.M interpreter]]</nowiki>, package "scummvm"
* xmame - An X-Windows frontend for the Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator [multiverse]
* <nowiki>[[http://sites.google.com/site/mamehub/|MAMEHub]]</nowiki> - An open-source extension of MAME & MESS that supports cross-platform netplay
